file_content.text: The heat that's building off of the war crimes story is incredible.
Welcome back. Ulgo's name is becoming sludge as we speak.
We're getting calls from all over Republic space. Usually when this happens, Organa recruitment goes up. Donations, too.
Not bad for one well-placed junior reporter and his security team.
Not bad for one well-placed junior reporter and his security professional.
It's important to get the truth out.
It needed to be shown.
Not just important, essential--if there's ever going to be any justice on this planet.
I get credit, right?
If there's one thing we accomplish in this office, it's to publicize our successes.
We just exposed a torture program and a mass grave site. I wouldn't sound so upbeat.
Don't celebrate this.
Yes, of course. I didn't mean to come off that way. But exposure like this helps the Republic and Organas immensely.
You did well out there. You gave us one of the biggest gifts a newsman can receive.
You got our junior reporter back from a war zone alive. Thank you.
Careful out there. The Ulgos on that ridge would shoot a grain of sand if it got too close.
I'll do it. It's better to risk losing me than anyone important to the team.
This isn't about you or me, it's about what'll be left of Alderaan if the Ulgos win.
See that? Dedication. Not easy to come by these days.
Where do we go?
Where to, first?
The house is on a ridge not far from the Ulgo headquarters.
This kid is laser bait. You seriously think he'll live?
This is a bad idea.
It's a risk--so stay hidden and on the move. The main thing is to get inside that building.
Get holo evidence of what went on there, and get out before the main army is alerted.
Then drop him off at a safe rendezvous point where we can pick him up. He knows the place.
Fyrel Cannor, holo-editor for the Nova. Good to meet you. You've made a name for yourself around here.
We've got an ugly security situation. Some of our senior staff investigated a structure--
Let me, Fy. Ulgo's hiding something and whatever it is, they think it's worth killing reporters.
What exactly is the story you were chasing?
Slow down and start over.
There's an outlying building in Ulgo-occupied territory. Something's going on there.
When we got close, Ulgo soldiers fired on us, even after we called out that we were press.
That is serious. You're sure it was Ulgo?
Isn't that a war crime?
I got a good look. Even after it was clear we were press, they shot to kill.
We don't know that the orders came from the top, but we do know our evidence leads to that outlying building on Crystal Ridge.
Have you thought of carrying a blaster?
So defend yourselves.
No. The last thing we need is to be labeled as "assassins."
We got near a particular Ulgo building. Our sources were terrified of it.
We think Bouris Ulgo, besides being a tyrant and usurper, has ordered war crimes perpetrated on prisoners in that building.
You need an escort? Done.
I can protect you.
Outstanding. Now we just need a volunteer to go back to the area.
What do you want me for?
You get one of us in and out of that house alive. We'll do the rest. Now, we need a volunteer to be escorted.
But before you speak, I should disclose we still don't have the body armor we ordered.
[Silence.]
[Silence.]
I came to this planet to win a war, not cover one.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
We're not asking you to. Just protect one of us while we do our job. Now, who's willing to penetrate Ulgo territory?
The truth will prevail. How fast it does is up to us.
All right. Tret it is. You ready for this?
Tret's footage is going live now. It's already getting requests for galactic coverage.
I'm impressed.
